definition: glutton/chowhound
to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations
to puff up/to swell up/to inflate/to blow air into sth/(fig.) to encourage/to support
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: foolish talk/nonsense
lit. to gnaw a book/to study/to cram
lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities
pinyin: da3 zhong3 lian3 chong1 pang4 zi5

definition: to talk nonsense/to bullshit
keenly felt pain/bitter anguish
to exhaust one's limited abilities (idiom)
trivial matter/a piece of cake
having nothing better to do
lit. Lord Ye's passion for dragons (idiom)/fig. to pretend to be fond of sth while actually fearing it/ostensible fondness of sth one really fears
(not) a single person/(no) one
half a life/only half alive/barely alive/(scared, beaten etc) half to death
A rabbit doesn't eat the grass by its own burrow (idiom); One shouldn't do anything to harm one's neighbors.
pinyin: tu4 zi5 bu4 chi1 wo1 bian1 cao3
